Hapkido.name: Hapkido

image.attribution: Nathan Hall from USA, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
image.alt_text: Two hapkido practitioners demonstrating a wrist lock and throw technique.

description: Hapkido is a hybrid martial art focused on self-defense using joint locks, throws, and strikes.
It developed in Korea and was influenced by Japanese and Korean martial arts, combining circular motion with practical techniques.
Students learn joint locks, kicks, strikes, throws, and self-defense scenarios, while training balance, coordination, and awareness.
People practice Hapkido to build confidence, flexibility, and practical self-defense skills.
benefits: Develops versatile striking and grappling skills.
Improves flexibility, coordination, and balance.
Teaches practical self-defense and situational awareness.
Builds confidence and adaptability in combat.

JeetKuneDo.name: Jeet Kune Do

image.attribution: RisingSunWiki, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
image.alt_text: Logo symbol representing Jeet Kune Do martial art.

description: Jeet Kune Do is a martial art philosophy that focuses on efficiency, simplicity, and adaptability, emphasizing what works in real combat.
It was developed by Bruce Lee, drawing from multiple martial arts to create a practical self-defense system.
Training includes striking, footwork, timing, trapping, and adaptability to different situations.
People practice Jeet Kune Do to develop freedom of movement, speed, and personal expression in combat.
benefits: Encourages fluidity and adaptability in fighting.
Improves speed, timing, and reflexes.
Combines striking and grappling knowledge for versatility.
Promotes personal expression and creativity in combat.

Kajukenbo.name: Kajukenbo

image.attribution: Kl8on, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
image.alt_text: Crest symbol representing the Kajukenbo martial art.

description: Kajukenbo is a hybrid martial art designed for real-world self-defense, blending multiple martial arts techniques.
It was developed in Hawaii by combining Karate, Judo, Jiu-Jitsu, Kenpo, and Boxing.
Students learn strikes, takedowns, grappling, and defensive combinations in practical scenarios.
People practice Kajukenbo to gain versatile self-defense skills and overall physical conditioning.
benefits: Builds a broad skill set covering striking and grappling.
Improves speed, coordination, and reaction time.
Teaches practical self-defense for real situations.
Encourages mental focus and adaptability.

Kalaripayattu.name: Kalaripayattu

image.attribution: Ginu Plathottam, CC0, via Wikimedia Commons

description: Kalaripayattu is one of the oldest martial arts in the world, originating in southern India, combining strikes, grappling, and weapons training.
It emphasizes fluid movements, agility, flexibility, and precise strikes, along with throws, joint locks, and ground techniques.
Students also train with traditional weapons such as sticks, swords, daggers, and the flexible urumi.
People practice Kalaripayattu for self-defense, physical fitness, discipline, and preservation of cultural heritage.
Kalaripayattu.competition_format: Mostly demonstrations and performance-based events; some sparring in traditional schools
benefits: Develops versatility in strikes, grappling, and weapons techniques.
Improves balance, agility, flexibility, and coordination.
Teaches practical self-defense and situational awareness.
Preserves cultural martial arts heritage and promotes discipline.

Kenpo.name: Kenpo

image.attribution: Rodomontade at English Wikipedia, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
image.alt_text: A Kenpo martial artist demonstrating a double punch technique.

description: Kenpo is a fast-paced hybrid martial art focusing on rapid strikes, self-defense, and flow between techniques.
It evolved from traditional Asian martial arts and was adapted in the United States for practical self-defense.
Training includes punches, kicks, blocks, and combinations integrating both striking and grappling principles.
People practice Kenpo to improve speed, coordination, and confidence.
benefits: Develops rapid, coordinated striking skills.
Enhances reflexes and reaction time.
Teaches transitions between striking and grappling.
Builds confidence and mental focus.

KravMaga.name: Krav Maga

image.attribution: TZAHAL, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons
image.alt_text: Two Krav Maga practitioners demonstrating a self-defense technique.

description: Krav Maga is a practical hybrid self-defense system designed for real-life combat situations.
It was developed for Israeli military and law enforcement, focusing on simplicity and effectiveness.
Students learn strikes, defenses, disarms, and situational awareness to neutralize threats quickly.
People practice Krav Maga to build confidence, personal safety, and practical combat skills.
benefits: Develops practical and effective self-defense skills.
Improves reaction time and awareness.
Builds confidence and resilience.
Enhances full-body fitness and conditioning.

MixedMartialArts.name: Mixed Martial Arts

image.attribution: Aleks Fight, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
image.alt_text: Two mixed martial arts fighters competing in the EU MMA Championship 2021 in Kazan, Russia.

description: Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) is a hybrid sport combining striking, grappling, and submission techniques from multiple martial arts.
It developed as a competitive system allowing striking and grappling to coexist in one sport.
Training includes boxing, Muay Thai, wrestling, Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, and other martial arts.
People practice MMA for competition, fitness, and comprehensive combat skills.
benefits: Develops well-rounded striking and grappling skills.
Improves endurance, strength, and conditioning.
Teaches adaptability and problem-solving under pressure.
Encourages mental toughness and resilience.

Ninjutsu.name: Ninjutsu

image.attribution: https://www.flickr.com/photos/dannychoo/ Danny Choo, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
image.alt_text: Modern depiction of a ninja holding a ninjato (ninja sword).

description: Ninjutsu is a traditional hybrid martial art focusing on stealth, strategy, and self-defense.
It was developed in Japan and includes techniques for evasion, grappling, striking, and survival skills.
Students learn movement, stealth, grappling, weapon skills, and situational awareness.
People practice Ninjutsu to improve coordination, focus, adaptability, and historical martial knowledge.
benefits: Develops diverse combat and survival skills.
Improves balance, coordination, and reflexes.
Enhances adaptability and awareness.
Preserves historical martial arts knowledge.

Silat.name: Silat

image.attribution: Maizal Chaniago, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
image.alt_text: Silek Jarami is a contemporary martial art typical of Minangkabau, West Sumatra. Named after the arena where the show is performed, which is in the form of rice straw that is collected after harvest.

description: Silat is a hybrid martial art originating from Southeast Asia, combining strikes, joint locks, throws, and weapon techniques.
It developed across Indonesia, Malaysia, and neighboring regions, with each style emphasizing fluid movements, strategy, and adaptability.
Students train in striking, grappling, sweeps, takedowns, and often weapons such as knives, sticks, or machetes.
People practice Silat to improve self-defense skills, coordination, agility, and cultural appreciation of traditional Southeast Asian martial arts.
Silat.competition_format: Point-based sparring or demonstration competitions, depending on style
benefits: Develops versatility in striking and grappling techniques.
Improves balance, agility, coordination, and reflexes.
Teaches practical self-defense and situational awareness.
Preserves cultural martial arts heritage and promotes discipline.
